analysis.Summary: Vue component providing an address autocomplete input using Google Maps Places API.
analysis.Purpose: Allow users to type and select an address; automatically emit selected address, geographic coordinates, and parsed country/state/city back to parent components.

Components.name: <template>
Components.responsibility: Renders label (if provided), text input for address, and validation feedback.

Components.name: <script setup>
Components.responsibility: Initializes Google Maps Places Autocomplete, handles place selection, defines props and emits.

Components.name: styles (.pac-container)
Components.responsibility: Styles the Google Places suggestion dropdown container.

Functions.name: onPlaceChanged
Functions.purpose: Called when user selects a place from autocomplete suggestions. Extracts formatted_address, latitude/longitude, country, state, city, then emits updates.
Functions.parameters: none (uses closure over props, emit, autocomplete)

Functions.name: loader.load().then(...) callback
Functions.purpose: After Google Maps API loads, initializes Autocomplete on the input and registers onPlaceChanged listener.
Functions.parameters: none (uses closure over props.apiKey, props.locale, addressInput)

Functions.name: onMounted
Functions.purpose: Vue lifecycle hook to kick off Google Maps JS API loading once component mounts.

analysis.Usage: Imported into parent components and used via e.g. <Address :apiKey="apikey" v-model:address="addr" @update:location="onLoc"/>. Parent listens to emitted events to capture address data.
Notes: The component expects an external validation prop under $attrs (e.g. passed via a form library) to show errors.
An onInput handler is referenced in template but not defined â€“ likely intended to emit 'update:address' on raw typing.
watchEffect import is unused and can be removed.
Styles target .pac-container, the default Google suggestions container, for z-index and appearance adjustments.
